ball.m = 1
g = 9.8

dt = 0.01

    rate(100)
    Length_I = new_length # new_length should be updated based on the new input
    Radius_I = new_radius # new_radius should be updated based on the new input
    ball.radius = Radius_I 
    rod.length = Length_I
    alpha = - g / Length_I * sin(ball.theta)
    ball.omega += alpha * dt
    d_theta = ball.omega * dt
    ball.theta += d_theta
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(ball.theta), -Length_I*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
interactions.output:
from vpython import *

# cyber input variable mapping
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# create the scene of the pendulum
scene = canvas(title='Simple Pendulum', width=800, height=800, center=vector(0,-Length_I/2,0), background=color.white)
# create the ceiling
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, pos=vector(0,0,0))
# create the ball
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)

# create the rod
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01)

# initialize
ball.pos = vector(Length_I,0,0)
rod.axis = ball.pos
ball.v = vector(0,0,0)
ball.m = 1
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 30 * pi / 180
ball.omega = 0
t = 0
dt = 0.01

while True:
    rate(100)
    new_length = Length_I  # assuming new_length should be the same as Length_I
    new_radius = Radius_I  # assuming new_radius should be the same as Radius_I
    ball.radius = new_radius 
    rod.length = new_length
    alpha = - g / new_length * sin(ball.theta)
    ball.omega += alpha * dt
    d_theta = ball.omega * dt
    ball.theta += d_theta
    ball.pos = vector(new_length*sin(ball.theta), -new_length*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
